drug.name: Chloroform
drug.description: Chloroform is an organic small molecule, member of the family of the chloromethanes that presents a formula of CHCl3. It is a colorless, sweet-smelling, dense liquid that is produced on a large scale as a precursor to PTFE and refrigerants, but the latter application is declining.

article.citation: FEATHERSTONE HW: Chloroform. Anesthesiology. 1947 Jul;8(4):362-71.
PAYNE JP: Chloroform. Med Illus. 1955 Oct;9(10):627-30.
Authors unspecified: Chloroform. Rep Carcinog. 2002;10:54-6.
Davison MH: Chloroform. Br J Anaesth. 1965 Sep;37(9):655-60.
Authors unspecified: Chloroform. Rep Carcinog. 2004;11:III54-6.
Authors unspecified: Chloroform. IARC Monogr Eval Carcinog Risks Hum. 1999;73:131-82.
Authors unspecified: Chloroform. Rep Carcinog. 2011;12:97-100.
Authors unspecified: Chloroform. IARC Monogr Eval Carcinog Risk Chem Hum. 1979 Oct;20:401-27.
Lister J: Chloroform Accidents. Br Med J. 1871 Jul 29;2(552):117-9.
Prichard A: Chloroform Accidents. Br Med J. 1873 Feb 22;1(634):194-6.
Firth NL, Ross DA, Thonney ML: Comparison of ether and chloroform for Soxhlet extraction of freeze-dried animal tissues. J Assoc Off Anal Chem. 1985 Nov-Dec;68(6):1228-31.
Exner T, Papadopoulos G, Sahman N, Koutts J: Solvent extraction of test plasmas for improved recovery of lupus anticoagulant activity. Thromb Haemost. 1990 Aug 13;64(1):121-3.
Barker JL, Gainer H: Pentobarbital: selective depression of excitatory postsynaptic potentials. Science. 1973 Nov 16;182(4113):720-2.

Huo Y, Guo C, Zhang QY, Chen WS, Zheng HC, Rahman K, Qin LP: Antinociceptive activity and chemical composition of constituents from Caragana microphylla seeds. Phytomedicine. 2007 Feb;14(2-3):143-6. Epub 2006 May 16.

Svetaz L, Tapia A, Lopez SN, Furlan RL, Petenatti E, Pioli R, Schmeda-Hirschmann G, Zacchino SA: Antifungal chalcones and new caffeic acid esters from Zuccagnia punctata acting against soybean infecting fungi. J Agric Food Chem. 2004 Jun 2;52(11):3297-300.
Schmidt CW: Chloroform: An EPA test case. Environ Health Perspect. 1999 Jul;107(7):A358-60.

Vajrabhaya LO, Suwannawong SK, Kamolroongwarakul R, Pewklieng L: Cytotoxicity evaluation of gutta-percha solvents: Chloroform and GP-Solvent (limonene). Oral Surg Oral Med Oral Pathol Oral Radiol Endod. 2004 Dec;98(6):756-9.
Lionte C: Lethal complications after poisoning with chloroform--case report and literature review. Hum Exp Toxicol. 2010 Jul;29(7):615-22. doi: 10.1177/0960327109357142. Epub 2010 Jan 5.
Cappelletti M, Frascari D, Zannoni D, Fedi S: Microbial degradation of chloroform. Appl Microbiol Biotechnol. 2012 Dec;96(6):1395-409. doi: 10.1007/s00253-012-4494-1. Epub 2012 Oct 24.

Yang M, Wang L, Xie G, Liu Y: Effects of intermediate metabolites of 37 xenobiotics on the catalytic activities of reconstituted cytochrome P-450IIB1 and P-450IA1 enzyme systems. Biomed Environ Sci. 1993 Mar;6(1):8-26.

Sprankle CS, Larson JL, Goldsworthy SM, Butterworth BE: Levels of myc, fos, Ha-ras, met and hepatocyte growth factor mRNA during regenerative cell proliferation in female mouse liver and male rat kidney after a cytotoxic dose of chloroform. Cancer Lett. 1996 Mar 19;101(1):97-106.

textbook.citation: Yannai, Shmuel (2003). Dictionary of Food Compounds with : Additives, Flavors, and Ingredients. CRC Press LLC.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as trihalomethanes. These are organic compounds in which exactly three of the four hydrogen atoms of methane (CH4) are replaced by halogen atoms.

category.category: Compounds used in a research, industrial, or household setting

drug-interaction.name: Enflurane
drug-interaction.description: The therapeutic efficacy of Chloroform can be increased when used in combination with Enflurane.
